intro: Ptyssiglottis zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's ptyssiglottis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountain range in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive pinnate arrangement, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Ptyssiglottis zollingeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
